Comments_List: I gained an understanding of the numerous factors that go into growth and yield modeling, as well as a basic understanding of how growth and yield modeling software works.
I became exposed to forest volumetric models (growth and yield)
This course was a good introduction to growth and yield modeling software, specifically the application of FVS. I learned the basic of how to use the software and what growth and yield means.
The course went better than expected. Dr. Weiskittel taught the subject matter in an engaging and straightforward manner. He knows the subject matter well and is a good instructor.
I thought we would spend more time actually applying the software and becoming familiarized with it's use rather than talking about the theory and background behind it's use.
It's hard squeezing all of the course material into a two-day workshop. It would be great if it were a small portion of a larger forest measurements and modeling course.

Strengths: good thing to get exposed to
Weaknesses: not very much time to actually engage with material

This workshop was a GREAT improvement from the course that was taught last year, and gave us some technical understanding of using growth and yield in forest management activities. Yet, it didn't really dive deep into the practical use of the software. If the same content, and the same instructor, were to teach a semester long course with more technical, computer lab time, the class would be just what students need.
If it is taught by the same instructor, then I would highly recommend it.
Make sure to do the pre-course reading
This course is a good introduction but don't expect to walk away with a thorough understanding of using growth and yield software.
